title: 1D kinematics - a from v graph - x from v equation

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A cart is moving along a straight track. The cart’s position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is initially zero, and its velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is described by the equation <math alttext="v of t equals, b t squared minus c t" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math> are positive constants. The cart is instantaneously at rest at time <math alttext="t equals t sub R" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. (a) On the axes in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, sketch a graph of the cart’s acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for the time interval shown. In parts (b) and (c), express your answers in terms of <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

frqParts.text: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A cart is moving along a straight track. The cart’s position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is initially zero, and its velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is described by the equation <math alttext="v of t equals, b t squared minus c t" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math> are positive constants. The cart is instantaneously at rest at time <math alttext="t equals t sub R" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. (a) On the axes in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, sketch a graph of the cart’s acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for the time interval shown. In parts (b) and (c), express your answers in terms of <math alttext="b" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

(b) Derive an expression for the cart’s position <math alttext="x sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math> that is negative and the farthest away from the initial position <math alttext="open parenthesis, x equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>.

(c) Derive an expression for the velocity <math alttext="v sub O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>O</mtext></msub></math> that the cart has when it passes through the position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> at a later time <math alttext="t greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

skill.text: 1.C: Create qualitative sketches of graphs that represent features of a model or the behavior of a physical system.
